00021 /* 
00022   This file functions as the primary feedback interface for Grbl. Any outgoing data, such 
00023   as the protocol status messages, feedback messages, and status reports, are stored here.
00024   For the most part, these functions primarily are called from protocol.c methods. If a 
00025   different style feedback is desired (i.e. JSON), then a user can change these following 
00026   methods to accomodate their needs.
00027 */
00028 
00029 #include "system.h"
00030 #include "report.h"
00031 #include "print.h"
00032 #include "settings.h"
00033 #include "gcode.h"
00034 #include "coolant_control.h"
00035 #include "planner.h"
00036 #include "spindle_control.h"

00038 
00039 // Handles the primary confirmation protocol response for streaming interfaces and human-feedback.
00040 // For every incoming line, this method responds with an 'ok' for a successful command or an 
00041 // 'error:'  to indicate some error event with the line or some critical system error during 
00042 // operation. Errors events can originate from the g-code parser, settings module, or asynchronously
00043 // from a critical error, such as a triggered hard limit. Interface should always monitor for these
00044 // responses.
00045 // NOTE: In silent mode, all error codes are greater than zero.
00046 // TODO: Install silent mode to return only numeric values, primarily for GUIs.
00047 void report_status_message(uint8_t status_code) 
00048 {
00049   if (status_code == 0) { // STATUS_OK
00050     printPgmString(PSTR("ok\r\n"));
00051   } else {
00052     printPgmString(PSTR("error: "));
00053     switch(status_code) {          
00054       case STATUS_BAD_NUMBER_FORMAT:
00055       printPgmString(PSTR("Bad number format")); break;
00056       case STATUS_EXPECTED_COMMAND_LETTER:
00057       printPgmString(PSTR("Expected command letter")); break;
00058       case STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT:
00059       printPgmString(PSTR("Unsupported statement")); break;
00060       case STATUS_ARC_RADIUS_ERROR:
00061       printPgmString(PSTR("Invalid radius")); break;
00062       case STATUS_MODAL_GROUP_VIOLATION:
00063       printPgmString(PSTR("Modal group violation")); break;
00064       case STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT:
00065       printPgmString(PSTR("Invalid statement")); break;
00066       case STATUS_SETTING_DISABLED:
00067       printPgmString(PSTR("Setting disabled")); break;
00068       case STATUS_SETTING_VALUE_NEG:
00069       printPgmString(PSTR("Value < 0.0")); break;
00070       case STATUS_SETTING_STEP_PULSE_MIN:
00071       printPgmString(PSTR("Value < 3 usec")); break;
00072       case STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL:
00073       printPgmString(PSTR("EEPROM read fail. Using defaults")); break;
00074       case STATUS_IDLE_ERROR:
00075       printPgmString(PSTR("Not idle")); break;
00076       case STATUS_ALARM_LOCK:
00077       printPgmString(PSTR("Alarm lock")); break;
00078       case STATUS_SOFT_LIMIT_ERROR:
00079       printPgmString(PSTR("Homing not enabled")); break;
00080       case STATUS_OVERFLOW:
00081       printPgmString(PSTR("Line overflow")); break; 
00082     }
00083     printPgmString(PSTR("\r\n"));
00084   }
00085 }
00086 
00087 // Prints alarm messages.
00088 void report_alarm_message(int8_t alarm_code)
00089 {
00090   printPgmString(PSTR("ALARM: "));
00091   switch (alarm_code) {
00092     case ALARM_LIMIT_ERROR: 
00093     printPgmString(PSTR("Hard/soft limit")); break;
00094     case ALARM_ABORT_CYCLE: 
00095     printPgmString(PSTR("Abort during cycle")); break;
00096     case ALARM_PROBE_FAIL:
00097     printPgmString(PSTR("Probe fail")); break;
00098   }
00099   printPgmString(PSTR("\r\n"));
00100   delay_ms(500); // Force delay to ensure message clears serial write buffer.
00101 }
00102 
00103 // Prints feedback messages. This serves as a centralized method to provide additional
00104 // user feedback for things that are not of the status/alarm message protocol. These are
00105 // messages such as setup warnings, switch toggling, and how to exit alarms.
00106 // NOTE: For interfaces, messages are always placed within brackets. And if silent mode
00107 // is installed, the message number codes are less than zero.
00108 // TODO: Install silence feedback messages option in settings
00109 void report_feedback_message(uint8_t message_code)
00110 {
00111   printPgmString(PSTR("["));
00112   switch(message_code) {
00113     case MESSAGE_CRITICAL_EVENT:
00114     printPgmString(PSTR("Reset to continue")); break;
00115     case MESSAGE_ALARM_LOCK:
00116     printPgmString(PSTR("'$H'|'$X' to unlock")); break;
00117     case MESSAGE_ALARM_UNLOCK:
00118     printPgmString(PSTR("Caution: Unlocked")); break;
00119     case MESSAGE_ENABLED:
00120     printPgmString(PSTR("Enabled")); break;
00121     case MESSAGE_DISABLED:
00122     printPgmString(PSTR("Disabled")); break; 
00123   }
00124   printPgmString(PSTR("]\r\n"));
00125 }

00128 // Welcome message
00129 void report_init_message()
00130 {
00131   printPgmString(PSTR("\r\nGrbl " GRBL_VERSION " ['$' for help]\r\n"));
00132 }

00134 // Grbl help message
00135 void report_grbl_help() {
00136   printPgmString(PSTR("$$ (view Grbl settings)\r\n"
00137                       "$# (view # parameters)\r\n"
00138                       "$G (view parser state)\r\n"
00139                       "$N (view startup blocks)\r\n"
00140                       "$x=value (save Grbl setting)\r\n"
00141                       "$Nx=line (save startup block)\r\n"
00142                       "$C (check gcode mode)\r\n"
00143                       "$X (kill alarm lock)\r\n"
00144                       "$H (run homing cycle)\r\n"
00145                       "~ (cycle start)\r\n"
00146                       "! (feed hold)\r\n"
00147                       "? (current status)\r\n"
00148                       "ctrl-x (reset Grbl)\r\n"));
00149 }

00151 // Grbl global settings print out.
00152 // NOTE: The numbering scheme here must correlate to storing in settings.c
00153 void report_grbl_settings() {
00154   printPgmString(PSTR("$0=")); printFloat(settings.steps_per_mm[X_AXIS]);
00155   printPgmString(PSTR(" (x, step/mm)\r\n$1=")); printFloat(settings.steps_per_mm[Y_AXIS]);
00156   printPgmString(PSTR(" (y, step/mm)\r\n$2=")); printFloat(settings.steps_per_mm[Z_AXIS]);
00157   printPgmString(PSTR(" (z, step/mm)\r\n$3=")); printFloat(settings.max_rate[X_AXIS]);
00158   printPgmString(PSTR(" (x max rate, mm/min)\r\n$4=")); printFloat(settings.max_rate[Y_AXIS]);
00159   printPgmString(PSTR(" (y max rate, mm/min)\r\n$5=")); printFloat(settings.max_rate[Z_AXIS]);
00160   printPgmString(PSTR(" (z max rate, mm/min)\r\n$6=")); printFloat(settings.acceleration[X_AXIS]/(60*60)); // Convert from mm/min^2 for human readability
00161   printPgmString(PSTR(" (x accel, mm/sec^2)\r\n$7=")); printFloat(settings.acceleration[Y_AXIS]/(60*60)); // Convert from mm/min^2 for human readability
00162   printPgmString(PSTR(" (y accel, mm/sec^2)\r\n$8=")); printFloat(settings.acceleration[Z_AXIS]/(60*60)); // Convert from mm/min^2 for human readability
00163   printPgmString(PSTR(" (z accel, mm/sec^2)\r\n$9=")); printFloat(-settings.max_travel[X_AXIS]); // Grbl internally store this as negative.
00164   printPgmString(PSTR(" (x max travel, mm)\r\n$10=")); printFloat(-settings.max_travel[Y_AXIS]); // Grbl internally store this as negative.
00165   printPgmString(PSTR(" (y max travel, mm)\r\n$11=")); printFloat(-settings.max_travel[Z_AXIS]); // Grbl internally store this as negative.
00166   printPgmString(PSTR(" (z max travel, mm)\r\n$12=")); printInteger(settings.pulse_microseconds);
00167   printPgmString(PSTR(" (step pulse, usec)\r\n$13=")); printFloat(settings.default_feed_rate);
00168   printPgmString(PSTR(" (default feed, mm/min)\r\n$14=")); printInteger(settings.step_invert_mask); 
00169   printPgmString(PSTR(" (step port invert mask:")); print_uint8_base2(settings.step_invert_mask);  
00170   printPgmString(PSTR(")\r\n$15=")); printInteger(settings.dir_invert_mask); 
00171   printPgmString(PSTR(" (dir port invert mask:")); print_uint8_base2(settings.dir_invert_mask);  
00172   printPgmString(PSTR(")\r\n$16=")); printInteger(settings.stepper_idle_lock_time);
00173   printPgmString(PSTR(" (step idle delay, msec)\r\n$17=")); printFloat(settings.junction_deviation);
00174   printPgmString(PSTR(" (junction deviation, mm)\r\n$18=")); printFloat(settings.arc_tolerance);
00175   printPgmString(PSTR(" (arc tolerance, mm)\r\n$19=")); printInteger(settings.decimal_places);
00176   printPgmString(PSTR(" (n-decimals, int)\r\n$20=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES));
00177   printPgmString(PSTR(" (report inches, bool)\r\n$21=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_AUTO_START));
00178   printPgmString(PSTR(" (auto start, bool)\r\n$22=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_INVERT_ST_ENABLE));
00179   printPgmString(PSTR(" (invert step enable, bool)\r\n$23=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_INVERT_LIMIT_PINS));
00180   printPgmString(PSTR(" (invert limit pins, bool)\r\n$24=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_SOFT_LIMIT_ENABLE));
00181   printPgmString(PSTR(" (soft limits, bool)\r\n$25=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_HARD_LIMIT_ENABLE));
00182   printPgmString(PSTR(" (hard limits, bool)\r\n$26=")); printInteger(bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE));
00183   printPgmString(PSTR(" (homing cycle, bool)\r\n$27=")); printInteger(settings.homing_dir_mask);
00184   printPgmString(PSTR(" (homing dir invert mask:")); print_uint8_base2(settings.homing_dir_mask);  
00185   printPgmString(PSTR(")\r\n$28=")); printFloat(settings.homing_feed_rate);
00186   printPgmString(PSTR(" (homing feed, mm/min)\r\n$29=")); printFloat(settings.homing_seek_rate);
00187   printPgmString(PSTR(" (homing seek, mm/min)\r\n$30=")); printInteger(settings.homing_debounce_delay);
00188   printPgmString(PSTR(" (homing debounce, msec)\r\n$31=")); printFloat(settings.homing_pulloff);
00189   printPgmString(PSTR(" (homing pull-off, mm)\r\n")); 
00190 }

00193 // Prints current probe parameters. Upon a probe command, these parameters are updated upon a
00194 // successful probe or upon a failed probe with the G38.3 without errors command (if supported). 
00195 // These values are retained until Grbl is power-cycled, whereby they will be re-zeroed.
00196 void report_probe_parameters()
00197 {
00198   uint8_t i;
00199   float print_position[N_AXIS];
00200  
00201   // Report in terms of machine position.
00202   printPgmString(PSTR("[Probe:")); 
00203   for (i=0; i< N_AXIS; i++) {
00204     print_position[i] = sys.probe_position[i]/settings.steps_per_mm[i];
00205     if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES)) { print_position[i] *= INCH_PER_MM; }
00206     printFloat(print_position[i]);
00207     if (i < (N_AXIS-1)) { printPgmString(PSTR(",")); }
00208   }  
00209   printPgmString(PSTR("]\r\n"));
00210 }
00211 
00212 
00213 // Prints Grbl NGC parameters (coordinate offsets, probing)
00214 void report_ngc_parameters()
00215 {
00216   float coord_data[N_AXIS];
00217   uint8_t coord_select, i;
00218   for (coord_select = 0; coord_select <= SETTING_INDEX_NCOORD; coord_select++) { 
00219     if (!(settings_read_coord_data(coord_select,coord_data))) { 
00220       report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL); 
00221       return;
00222     } 
00223     printPgmString(PSTR("[G"));
00224     switch (coord_select) {
00225       case 0: printPgmString(PSTR("54:")); break;
00226       case 1: printPgmString(PSTR("55:")); break;
00227       case 2: printPgmString(PSTR("56:")); break;
00228       case 3: printPgmString(PSTR("57:")); break;
00229       case 4: printPgmString(PSTR("58:")); break;
00230       case 5: printPgmString(PSTR("59:")); break;
00231       case 6: printPgmString(PSTR("28:")); break;
00232       case 7: printPgmString(PSTR("30:")); break;
00233       // case 8: printPgmString(PSTR("92:")); break; // G92.2, G92.3 not supported. Hence not stored.  
00234     }           
00235     for (i=0; i<N_AXIS; i++) {
00236       if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES)) { printFloat(coord_data[i]*INCH_PER_MM); }
00237       else { printFloat(coord_data[i]); }
00238       if (i < (N_AXIS-1)) { printPgmString(PSTR(",")); }
00239       else { printPgmString(PSTR("]\r\n")); }
00240     } 
00241   }
00242   printPgmString(PSTR("[G92:")); // Print G92,G92.1 which are not persistent in memory
00243   for (i=0; i<N_AXIS; i++) {
00244     if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES)) { printFloat(gc.coord_offset[i]*INCH_PER_MM); }
00245     else { printFloat(gc.coord_offset[i]); }
00246     if (i < (N_AXIS-1)) { printPgmString(PSTR(",")); }
00247     else { printPgmString(PSTR("]\r\n")); }
00248   } 
00249   report_probe_parameters(); // Print probe parameters. Not persistent in memory.
00250 }
00251

00253 // Print current gcode parser mode state
00254 void report_gcode_modes()
00255 {
00256   switch (gc.motion_mode) {
00257     case MOTION_MODE_SEEK : printPgmString(PSTR("[G0")); break;
00258     case MOTION_MODE_LINEAR : printPgmString(PSTR("[G1")); break;
00259     case MOTION_MODE_CW_ARC : printPgmString(PSTR("[G2")); break;
00260     case MOTION_MODE_CCW_ARC : printPgmString(PSTR("[G3")); break;
00261     case MOTION_MODE_CANCEL : printPgmString(PSTR("[G80")); break;
00262   }
00263 
00264   printPgmString(PSTR(" G"));
00265   printInteger(gc.coord_select+54);
00266   
00267   if (gc.plane_axis_0 == X_AXIS) {
00268     if (gc.plane_axis_1 == Y_AXIS) { printPgmString(PSTR(" G17")); }
00269     else { printPgmString(PSTR(" G18")); }
00270   } else { printPgmString(PSTR(" G19")); }
00271   
00272   if (gc.inches_mode) { printPgmString(PSTR(" G20")); }
00273   else { printPgmString(PSTR(" G21")); }
00274   
00275   if (gc.absolute_mode) { printPgmString(PSTR(" G90")); }
00276   else { printPgmString(PSTR(" G91")); }
00277   
00278   if (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) { printPgmString(PSTR(" G93")); }
00279   else { printPgmString(PSTR(" G94")); }
00280     
00281   switch (gc.program_flow) {
00282     case PROGRAM_FLOW_RUNNING : printPgmString(PSTR(" M0")); break;
00283     case PROGRAM_FLOW_PAUSED : printPgmString(PSTR(" M1")); break;
00284     case PROGRAM_FLOW_COMPLETED : printPgmString(PSTR(" M2")); break;
00285   }
00286 
00287   switch (gc.spindle_direction) {
00288     case SPINDLE_ENABLE_CW : printPgmString(PSTR(" M3")); break;
00289     case SPINDLE_ENABLE_CCW : printPgmString(PSTR(" M4")); break;
00290     case SPINDLE_DISABLE : printPgmString(PSTR(" M5")); break;
00291   }
00292   
00293   switch (gc.coolant_mode) {
00294     case COOLANT_DISABLE : printPgmString(PSTR(" M9")); break;
00295     case COOLANT_FLOOD_ENABLE : printPgmString(PSTR(" M8")); break;
00296     #ifdef ENABLE_M7
00297       case COOLANT_MIST_ENABLE : printPgmString(PSTR(" M7")); break;
00298     #endif
00299   }
00300   
00301   printPgmString(PSTR(" T"));
00302   printInteger(gc.tool);
00303   
00304   printPgmString(PSTR(" F"));
00305   if (gc.inches_mode) { printFloat(gc.feed_rate*INCH_PER_MM); }
00306   else { printFloat(gc.feed_rate); }
00307 
00308   printPgmString(PSTR("]\r\n"));
00309 }

00311 // Prints specified startup line
00312 void report_startup_line(uint8_t n, char *line)
00313 {
00314   printPgmString(PSTR("$N")); printInteger(n);
00315   printPgmString(PSTR("=")); printString(line);
00316   printPgmString(PSTR("\r\n"));
00317 }

00320 // Prints build info line
00321 void report_build_info(char *line)
00322 {
00323   printPgmString(PSTR("[" GRBL_VERSION "." GRBL_VERSION_BUILD ":"));
00324   printString(line);
00325   printPgmString(PSTR("]\r\n"));
00326 }

00329  // Prints real-time data. This function grabs a real-time snapshot of the stepper subprogram 
00330  // and the actual location of the CNC machine. Users may change the following function to their
00331  // specific needs, but the desired real-time data report must be as short as possible. This is
00332  // requires as it minimizes the computational overhead and allows grbl to keep running smoothly, 
00333  // especially during g-code programs with fast, short line segments and high frequency reports (5-20Hz).
00334 void report_realtime_status()
00335 {
00336   // **Under construction** Bare-bones status report. Provides real-time machine position relative to 
00337   // the system power on location (0,0,0) and work coordinate position (G54 and G92 applied). Eventually
00338   // to be added are distance to go on block, processed block id, and feed rate. Also a settings bitmask
00339   // for a user to select the desired real-time data.
00340   uint8_t i;
00341   int32_t current_position[N_AXIS]; // Copy current state of the system position variable
00342   memcpy(current_position,sys.position,sizeof(sys.position));
00343   float print_position[N_AXIS];
00344  
00345   // Report current machine state
00346   switch (sys.state) {
00347     case STATE_IDLE: printPgmString(PSTR("<Idle")); break;
00348     case STATE_QUEUED: printPgmString(PSTR("<Queue")); break;
00349     case STATE_CYCLE: printPgmString(PSTR("<Run")); break;
00350     case STATE_HOLD: printPgmString(PSTR("<Hold")); break;
00351     case STATE_HOMING: printPgmString(PSTR("<Home")); break;
00352     case STATE_ALARM: printPgmString(PSTR("<Alarm")); break;
00353     case STATE_CHECK_MODE: printPgmString(PSTR("<Check")); break;
00354   }
00355  
00356   // Report machine position
00357   printPgmString(PSTR(",MPos:")); 
00358   for (i=0; i< N_AXIS; i++) {
00359     print_position[i] = current_position[i]/settings.steps_per_mm[i];
00360     if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES)) { print_position[i] *= INCH_PER_MM; }
00361     printFloat(print_position[i]);
00362     printPgmString(PSTR(","));
00363   }
00364   
00365   // Report work position
00366   printPgmString(PSTR("WPos:")); 
00367   for (i=0; i< N_AXIS; i++) {
00368     if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_REPORT_INCHES)) {
00369       print_position[i] -= (gc.coord_system[i]+gc.coord_offset[i])*INCH_PER_MM;
00370     } else {
00371       print_position[i] -= gc.coord_system[i]+gc.coord_offset[i];
00372     }
00373     printFloat(print_position[i]);
00374     if (i < (N_AXIS-1)) { printPgmString(PSTR(",")); }
00375   }
00376     
00377   #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00378   // Report current line number
00379   printPgmString(PSTR(",Ln:")); 
00380   int32_t ln=0;
00381   plan_block_t * pb = plan_get_current_block();
00382   if(pb != NULL) {
00383     ln = pb->line_number;
00384   } 
00385   printInteger(ln);
00386   #endif
00387     
00388   printPgmString(PSTR(">\r\n"));
00389 }
